How can I check free space on my SSD?
Use 'df -h /dev/sd[a-z]' where sd[a-z] is your SSD device.

Displaying disk usage of a USB drive.
Use 'df -h [USB_drive]' where [USB_drive] is the device name.
What command should be used to see how much space /var is using?
How can I inspect free storage on my external hard drive?
Use 'df /dev/[external_hdd_device]' where [external_hdd_device] is your device ID.

How do I list all running processes?
Show me every process currently running.
What's the best way to find out what a specific process is doing?
How can I view only the top 10 most consuming processes?
How do you check which user owns a specific process?
Use 'ps auxf' and search for the process ID.
Find out who started a particular process.
Use 'ps -ef | grep PID' (replace "PID" with the process ID).
Can I display only the running processes in memory?
How to list all background processes?
Show me all processes sorted by their start time.
List processes ordered by CPU usage.
How to display processes with a specific parent process?
Use 'ps -ef | grep PID' (replace "PID" with the parent process ID).
What's an efficient way to view all child processes of another running process?
Use 'ps -o pid,ppid --sort=ppid <pid>' (replace "<pid>" with the target process ID).
Display only processes from a specific user.
How can I show processes sorted by memory usage?
Is there a way to list all processes on a system without their timestamps?
Use 'ps -ef | cut -c 1-9' (this won't sort, only lists).
